<div id="readme" class="md" data-path="README.md"><article class="markdown-body entry-content" itemprop="text"><h1><a id="user-content-fatoujl" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#fatoujl"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Fatou.jl</h1>
<p><a href="https://travis-ci.org/chakravala/Fatou.jl" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/185b4d9fdf75d483edbb837fe01595467b66772d/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e6f72672f6368616b726176616c612f4661746f752e6a6c2e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Build Status" data-canonical-src="https://travis-ci.org/chakravala/Fatou.jl.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a> <a href="https://ci.appveyor.com/project/chakravala/fatou-jl" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/ea4e1e10e6a6c168c41dae54aad32976efbd57c1/68747470733a2f2f63692e6170707665796f722e636f6d2f6170692f70726f6a656374732f7374617475732f6d646174686a6d75376a6735377537373f7376673d74727565" alt="Build status" data-canonical-src="https://ci.appveyor.com/api/projects/status/mdathjmu7jg57u77?svg=true" style="max-width:100%;"></a> <a href="https://coveralls.io/github/chakravala/Fatou.jl?branch=master" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/cf503e01b416ea71da184cc212e3a5f79549dc42/68747470733a2f2f636f766572616c6c732e696f2f7265706f732f6769746875622f6368616b726176616c612f4661746f752e6a6c2f62616467652e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Coverage Status" data-canonical-src="https://coveralls.io/repos/github/chakravala/Fatou.jl/badge.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a> <a href="http://codecov.io/github/chakravala/Fatou.jl?branch=master" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/0d01f395e77a618cd4a0dc61309ac4c3c294aa82/687474703a2f2f636f6465636f762e696f2f6769746875622f6368616b726176616c612f4661746f752e6a6c2f636f7665726167652e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="codecov.io" data-canonical-src="http://codecov.io/github/chakravala/Fatou.jl/coverage.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>Julia package for Fatou sets. Install using <code>Pkg.add("Fatou")</code> in Julia. See <a href="https://github.com/chakravala/Fatou.jl/wiki/Explore-Fatou-sets-&amp;-fractals">Explore Fatou sets &amp; Fractals</a> in Wiki for detailed <em>examples</em>. This package provides: <code>fatou</code>, <code>juliafill</code>, <code>mandelbrot</code>, <code>newton</code>, <code>basin</code>, <code>plot</code>, and <code>orbit</code>; along with various internal functionality using <code>Reduce</code> and Julia expressions to help compute <code>Fatou.FilledSet</code> efficiently. Full documentation is included. The <code>fatou</code> function can be applied to a <code>Fatou.Define</code> object to produce a <code>Fatou.FilledSet</code>, which can then be passed as an argument to the <code>plot</code> function of <code>PyPlot</code>. Creation of <code>Fatou.Define</code> objects is done via passing a <code>parse</code>-able function expression string (in variables <code>z</code>, <code>c</code>) and optional keyword arguments to <code>juliafill</code>, <code>mandelbrot</code>, and <code>newton</code>.</p>
<h2><a id="user-content-background" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#background"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Background</h2>
<p>This package enables users of Julia lang to easily generate, explore, and share fractals of Julia, Mandelbrot, and Newton type. The name Fatou comes from the mathematician after whom the Fatou sets are named. Note that the Julia language is not named after the mathematician Julia after whom the Julia sets are named. This is a mere coincidence.</p>
<p><strong>Definition</strong> <em>(Julia set)</em>: For any holomorphic function on a complex plane, the boundary of the set of points whose result diverges when the function is iteratively evaluated at each point.</p>
<p><strong>Definition</strong> <em>(Fatou set)</em>: The Julia set’s complement is the set of fixed limit points from holomorphic recursion.</p>
<p><strong>Definition</strong> <em>(Mandelbrot set)</em>: The set of points on a complex parameter space for which the holomorphic recursion does not go to infinity from a common starting point <code>z0</code>.</p>
<p><strong>Definition</strong> <em>(Newton fractal)</em>: The Julia/Fatou set obtained from the recursion of the Newton method <code>z↦z−m⋅f(z)/f′(z)</code> applied to a holomorphic function.</p>
<p>The package has essentially two different plotting modes controlled by the <code>iter</code> boolean keyword, which toggles whether to color the image by iteration count or whether to use a default (or custom) limit-value coloring function.</p>
<p>The number of Julia threads available is detected at the startup and is reported it back. When a specified Fatou set is computed, multi-threading is used to compute the pixels.
Since each pixel is independent of any other pixel, it doesn’t matter in what order or on how many threads it is computed, the more you use the faster it is.
The environment variable <code>JULIA_NUM_THREADS</code> can be used to enable the multi-threading for more than 1 thread.</p>
<p>Please share your favorite fractals as <code>Fatou</code> snippet in the <a href="https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-fatou-jl-easily-share-julia-fractals" rel="nofollow">discussion thread</a>!</p>
<h2><a id="user-content-pyplotjl-compatability-features" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#pyplotjl-compatability-features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>PyPlot.jl compatability features</h2>
<p>The program can be initialized with <code>using Fatou, PyPlot</code> or <code>ImageInTerminal</code>.</p>
<p>A Fatou set is a collection of complex valued orbits of an iterated function. To help illustrate this, an additional feature is a plot function designed to visualize real-valued-orbits. The following is a cobweb orbit plot of a function:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-c1">juliafill</span>(:(z<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">0.67</span>),∂<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.25</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.5</span>],x0<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1.25</span>,orbit<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">17</span>,depth<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span>,n<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">147</span>) <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> orbit</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="img/orbit.png"><img src="img/orbit.png" alt="img/orbit.png" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>With <code>fatou</code> and <code>plot</code> it is simple to display a filled in Julia set:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>c <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">0.06</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-c1">0.67im</span>
nf <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">juliafill</span>(:(z<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-k">+</span><span class="pl-k">$</span>c),∂<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.5</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.5</span>,<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>],N<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">80</span>,n<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1501</span>,cmap<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>gnuplot<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,iter<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>)
<span class="pl-c1">plot</span>(<span class="pl-c1">fatou</span>(nf), bare<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>)</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="img/filled-julia.png"><img src="img/filled-julia.png" alt="img/filled-julia.png" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>It is also possible to switch to <code>mandelbrot</code> mode:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-c1">mandelbrot</span>(:(z<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-k">+</span>c),n<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">800</span>,N<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">20</span>,∂<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.91</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0.51</span>,<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1.21</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.21</span>],cmap<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>gist_earth<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> fatou <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> plot</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="img/mandelbrot.png"><img src="img/mandelbrot.png" alt="img/mandelbrot.png" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p><code>Fatou</code> also provides <code>basin</code> to display the the Newton / Fatou basins using set notation in LaTeX in <code>IJulia</code>.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre><span class="pl-c1">map</span>(display,[<span class="pl-c1">basin</span>(<span class="pl-c1">newton</span>(:(z<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)),i) <span class="pl-k">for</span> i <span class="pl-k">∈</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span>])</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." alt="D1(ϵ)" data-canonical-src="http://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?D_1(%5Cepsilon)%20=%20%5Cleft%5C%7Bz%5Cin%5Cmathbb%7BC%7D:%5Cleft%7C%5C,z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20r_i%5C,%5Cright%7C%3C%5Cepsilon,%5C,%5Cforall%20r_i(%5C,f(r_i)=0%20)%5Cright%5C%7D" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." alt="D2(ϵ)" data-canonical-src="http://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?D_2(%5Cepsilon)%20=%20%5Cleft%5C%7Bz%5Cin%5Cmathbb%7BC%7D:%5Cleft%7C%5C,z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20r_i%5C,%5Cright%7C%3C%5Cepsilon,%5C,%5Cforall%20r_i(%5C,f(r_i)=0%20)%5Cright%5C%7D" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." alt="D3(ϵ)" data-canonical-src="http://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?D_3(%5Cepsilon)%20=%20%5Cleft%5C%7Bz%5Cin%5Cmathbb%7BC%7D:%5Cleft%7C%5C,z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20%5Cleft(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%5Cright)%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20%5Cfrac%7Bz%5E%7B3%7D%20-%201%7D%7B3%20z%5E%7B2%7D%7D%20-%20r_i%5C,%5Cright%7C%3C%5Cepsilon,%5C,%5Cforall%20r_i(%5C,f(r_i)=0%20)%5Cright%5C%7D" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>Compute the Newton fractal Julia set for a function with annotated plot of iteration count:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>nf <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">newton</span>(:(z<span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>),n<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">800</span>,ϵ<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.1</span>,N<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">25</span>,iter<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>,cmap<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>jet<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
nf <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> fatou <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> plot
<span class="pl-c1">basin</span>(nf,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>)</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="img/newton.png"><img src="img/newton.png" alt="img/newton.png" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>Generalized Newton fractal example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>nf <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">newton</span>(:(<span class="pl-c1">sin</span>(z)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>),m<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1im</span>,∂<span class="pl-k">=</span>[<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>π<span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span>,<span class="pl-k">-</span>π<span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">3</span>,<span class="pl-k">-</span>π<span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>,π<span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>],n<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">500</span>,N<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">33</span>,iter<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">true</span>,ϵ<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.05</span>,cmap<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>cubehelix<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
nf <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> fatou <span class="pl-k">|&gt;</span> plot
<span class="pl-c1">basin</span>(nf,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>)</pre></div>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="img/generalized-newton.png"><img src="img/generalized-newton.png" alt="img/generalized-newton.png" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent."><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." alt="D2(ϵ)" data-canonical-src="http://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?D_2(%5Cepsilon)%20=%20%5Cleft%5C%7Bz%5Cin%5Cmathbb%7BC%7D:%5Cleft%7C%5C,z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B1%7D%7B%5Ccos%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20%5Cright%20)%7D%7D%20%5Cleft(1%20+%20i%5Cright)%20%5Cleft(%5Csin%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20%5Cright%20)%7D%20-%201%5Cright)%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B%5Cleft(1%20+%20i%5Cright)%20%5Cleft(%5Csin%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B1%7D%7B%5Ccos%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20%5Cright%20)%7D%7D%20%5Cleft(1%20+%20i%5Cright)%20%5Cleft(%5Csin%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20%5Cright%20)%7D%20-%201%5Cright)%20%5Cright%20)%7D%20-%201%5Cright)%7D%7B%5Ccos%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20-%20%5Cfrac%7B1%7D%7B%5Ccos%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20%5Cright%20)%7D%7D%20%5Cleft(1%20+%20i%5Cright)%20%5Cleft(%5Csin%7B%5Cleft%20(z%20%5Cright%20)%7D%20-%201%5Cright)%20%5Cright%20)%7D%7D%20-%20r_i%5C,%5Cright%7C%3C%5Cepsilon,%5C,%5Cforall%20r_i(%5C,f(r_i)=0%20)%5Cright%5C%7D" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<h2><a id="user-content-imageinterminaljl-compatibility" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#imageinterminaljl-compatibility"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>ImageInTerminal.jl compatibility</h2>
<p>When <code>using ImageInTerminal</code>, the display of a <code>Fatou.FilledSet</code> will be plotted automatically in the terminal.
The <code>orbit</code> method also has optional <code>UnicodePlots</code> compatibility.
Additional plotting support can be added via Pull-Request by adding another <code>Requires</code> script to the <code>__init__()</code> function definition.</p>
<h2><a id="user-content-detailed-explanation" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#detailed-explanation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Detailed Explanation</h2>
<p>View <a href="https://github.com/chakravala/Fatou.jl/wiki/Explore-Fatou-sets-&amp;-fractals">Explore Fatou sets &amp; Fractals</a> in Wiki for detailed <em>examples</em>.</p>
<h3><a id="user-content-troubleshooting-on-julia-101" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#troubleshooting-on-julia-101"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Troubleshooting on Julia 1.0.1+</h3>
<p>Note that <code>Fatou</code> is not compatible with Julia 1.0 but works on Julia 1.0.1 alright. Note that a stackoverflow error occurs on Julia 1.0.1+ when the <code>Reduce</code> package is precompiled with <code>ENV["REDPRE"]</code> flag set, therefore it is recommended to not set it.
If you encounter an unsatisfiable requirement in the package manager, an easy workaround is to use <code>dev Fatou</code> instead of <code>add Fatou</code>.</p>
